newsitem.title: USA: Computer Associates, Cheyenne win motion.
newsitem.headline: Computer Associates, Cheyenne win motion.

text.p: The Delaware Chancery Court has denied a motion to preliminarily enjoin the completion of Computer Associates International Inc's tender offer for Cheyenne Software Inc, the companies said.
The motion was based on charges that Cheyenne and its board members failed to disclose certain financial information related to the tender offer, the companies said in a statement.
The companies said the offer, started on October 11, is scheduled to expire at midnight EST on November 8.
Computer Associates, which makes software for businesses, announced on October 7 that it planned to buy Cheyenne for $30.50 a share in a deal valued at $1.2 billion.
Cheyenne makes storage management, anti-virus and communications software products for client/server networks.
